page.title: 19The Ridgeway Path.
page.content: This long distance path runs from Overton Hill to Ivinghoe Beacon in Buckinghamshire. From the A4 transport cafe the chalky path, as wide as a road, climbs northwards for a mile, from 170 to over 200 metres above sea level. It passes cultivated land, fenced on the right side, but mostly open on the left. On reaching{Fyfield Down,}it crosses grassland with sheep and cows grazing. It is truly a path not only for man, but for animals,too. This national{nature reserve}is a well preserved, bare landscape, possibly 4000 years old. The way is signposted by stone markers on the ground. One passes cattle troughs and numerous boulders. The path heads on towards Hackpen Hill and Barbary Castle.
